channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OR
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OR

item.title: Report E-2023080350
item.description:
Report E-2023080350

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-09
  • City: CLACKAMAS
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UPO experienced a UN1950 Gunk - Chlorinated Brake Parts Cleaner release from a box containing (12) 20-ounce aerosol cans. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 20-ounces of product released impacting the box/packaging only due to a forklift puncture. The damaged box containing (12) 20-ounce cans of product were placed into a 5-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023080335
item.description:
Report E-2023080335

  • City: CLACKAMAS
  • State: OR

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the poly 5 gallon pails of extract (un1197) had been punctured by a nail and had released 2 quarts of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: package notice to be stained and wet. place in tote to contain any additional spillage DescribePack: package loaded upside down from previous facility. Safety plugs in these cans do not hold/prevent seepage when cans not upright. Product bagged, but spilled liquid escaped bags DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in slavage drum

item.title: Report E-2023080103
item.description:
Report E-2023080103

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-19
  • City: CLACKAMAS
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UPO experienced a UN1463 Chromium Trioxide release from a 110-pound metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-cups of product released impacting a 2' x 2' area of the concrete dock floor due to a forklift puncture. The released product, damaged pail, and impacted pallet pieces were collected and containerized into a 30-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
